title: WILD THINGS: DIAMONDS IN THE ROUGH

segments.content: Written by

INT. MUSEUM - DAY A perfect rainbow is trapped inside two flawless DIAMONDS, glinting in the morning sun. Tounted on crushed velvet, the identical diamonds are on a glass covered pedal stool in the middle of a vast, marble MUSEUM HALL. The stunning beauty of the stones is matched only by the breathtaking beauty of the young woman who's admiring them. MARIE CLIFFORD's creamy seventeen year old skin is dappled in the cornucopia of colors emanating from the diamonds... She reaches out tentatively towards the glass case. Not to touch the diamonds, but to run her fingers over a picture that's mounted in the case below the priceless jewels. It's of a MOTHER cradling her BABY DAUGHTER...

segments.content: Today's the day, Mom...
Marie spins round, sees the bespectacled CURATOR, 60's, standing behind her.

dialogue.text: Marie spins round, sees the bespectacled CURATOR, 60's, standing behind her.

segments.content: Marie carefully adjusts the sign atop the glass case... 'THE MOTHER DAUGHTER DIAMONDS...' EXT. MUSEUM - DAY Marie fires up her powerful BMW, parked right outside the austere Museum building. The powerful stereo blasts, sending the birds fluttering skywards... CREDITS appear over... ARIEL FOOTAGE of a narrow highway, Marie's BMW streaking through the endless tract of Florida wetlands. In the water, GATORS, warm themselves in the early morning sun... MOVING over the vast tracts of swampland, flocks of tropical BIRDS stretch their majestic wings, locals speed across the stagnant waters in their deafening AIRBOATS... Through thick trees and foliage to trailer homes and tract housing and into the town of Blue Bay, where the nip/tucked denizens sip three martini lunches and tee off at the local country club.

segments.content: Marie steers her BMW into the showroom-like parking lot of Blue
Bay High School.
Marie guides her powerful car towards her parking spot, when...

She SLAMS on the brakes as a figure darts in front of her car.

          Almost gives her a heart attack, throwing her forward, flailing

          arms crashing into the stereo, then snapped back by her seatbelt.

          She sits stock still for a second, then looks up, out of her

          windshield at the young woman scouring at her, only inches from

          the front bumper of the BMW.

          The sudden jolt has changed the radio station. A newscaster

          rambles on...
... operation, aimed at finally capturing
the Black Widow suspect after a six month
trail of embezzlement and fraud, once
again failed to snare its subject.
ELENA SANDOVAL, 17, stands defiantly in front of the BMW, her
don't-fuck-with-me stare in direct contrast with her come-fuck-me
clothes.
Blue Bay Police Detective Michael
Morrison was able to recover over
$400,000 in stolen money, but the
suspect, described as Female, between
eighteen and thirty, remains at large...
Marie reaches out with a trembling hand, turns off the stereo,
then leans out of the car window.
Elena smiles wryly.

dialogue.text: Elena smiles wryly.

segments.content: And she means it...

dialogue.text: And she means it...

heading.raw_text: INT. BLUE BAY HIGH AUDITORIUM - MORNING

segments.content:
The auditorium is packed with the Blue Bay High student body. The

          natural order is clear, the pastel flock at the front, the meat

          headed jocks in the center, and the rejects at the back.

          Marie is amongst her sweater monkey friends, but she's still

          shocked by what happened out in the parking lot...
(handing over a present)
Happy birthday, babe. They ain't
diamonds, but you're just gonna have to
wait for those...
Marie tentatively opens the gift, sees a pair of OPAL EARRINGS.
(unconvincing)
Thank you. Thank you so much...
Marie looks back, to the far reaches of the auditorium where the freaks and geeks crowd round Elena, worshipping her like the Goddess she is...

dialogue.text: Marie looks back, to the far reaches of the auditorium where the freaks and geeks crowd round Elena, worshipping her like the Goddess she is...

segments.content: I...yeah...I'll be fine...It's
just...that new girl...I almost hit her
in the parking lot...
You mean the towel girl, the one who
transferred in? Jesus, she's trouble. You
know the only reason she's slinging
towels is 'cos it's court ordered...
Marie and Elena make brief, electric eye contact, across the sea
of hormonally challenged students as Principal LIONEL MOSSTER, his
ill-fitting sports jacket coffee-stained, steps onstage.
We're here today to address a growing
epidemic that affects all of you.
He pauses, waits for the student body to quiet down...
National studies report sexual activity
among students at an all-time high.
The students all cheer, naturally.
We'll see who's cheering when you've got
an unwanted pregnancy on your hands, or
get slapped with a paternity suit...Or
arrested for date rape. But don't take my
word for it...
He motions behind him to KRISTEN RICHARDS, early 30's, a natural
beauty who's doing her best to hide behind a bland gray suit and
glasses, and CHAD BORMAN, late 20s, devilishly handsome...
Miss Richards and Dr. Borman are here to
tell you about the pitfalls first hand...
Kristen steps up to the lectern.
Good morning, my name is Kristen
Richards. I'm an officer for the Miami
juvenile parole board, as some of you
already know...
Quick glance at Elena who rolls her eyes...
But that's not what brings me here today.
When I heard about Principal Mosster's
sex education program I thought I'd
volunteer my own personal story, in hopes
that you might learn from the mistakes I
made. Back in High school all I wanted to
do was get drunk, stoned and laid...
The students roar their approval.
By my junior year, my life was a blur of
cheap beer, anonymous sex, partying every
night of the week...
Elena covers her mouth, as if to cough...
(through fake coughs)
...whore...
Kristen ignores the slur.
And then, one night at some pathetic frat
party, someone slipped a roofie in my
drink...and raped me.
This quiets the auditorium.
There isn't a day goes by my skin doesn't
crawl when I think of the violation and
humiliation I endured. I can promise you
that if you make the same kind of wrong-
headed choices I did, you'll be seeing
Chad steps to the podium.

dialogue.text: Chad steps to the podium.

segments.content: Thank you, Miss Richards. My name's Dr.
Chad Borman. I run the forensics lab at
the police department, where my work has
helped convict hundreds of sex offenders.
Most teens like Ms. Richards never get
their lives together. The physical scars
may go away, but the emotional damage
stays forever.
While Chad drones on, MUDDY, a Gremlin-eyed drooler, sitting in
front of Elena, looks back at her shapely legs as she puts them up
on the back of the chair. He spots the ugly plastic bracelet
locked around one of her ankles.
That's not...what I think it is, is it?
The words catch in his throat.

dialogue.text: The words catch in his throat.

segments.content: One of them...Parole leashes...
Bingo.
So you can't, like, go more than ten
miles from the cop shop?
Elena taps the flashing red light on the plastic bracelet.
Back at the podium, Chad leans forward, making sure his words resonate with the student body.

character.name: Five. I got someone's panties in a bunch.

dialogue.text: Back at the podium, Chad leans forward, making sure his words resonate with the student body.

segments.content: And as for the perpetrators of this
heinous act, even if you are still a
minor, you will be tried as an adult,
and, if convicted, you will do hard time.
He pauses to let the impact of this wash over the students.
Are there any questions?
(calling out)
Yeah, I got one for Miss Richards.
Ask away.
When they found the scumbag who took your
precious flower of virginity, you sued
his sorry ass, right?
Kristen is taken aback by Elena's insensitivity, stumbles over her
words, finally spitting out the sad, sorry truth...
Uh, no, actually, I was never able to
make a positive ID. All I remember was
his alcohol-soaked breath whispering in
my ear, "You won't remember, but you'll
never forget..."
Elena cracks a sideways grin...
So what you're really saying is you
fucked for free...
Kristen has no answer to that. Principal Mosster does his best to
control the situation...
Miss Sandoval. You're on thin ice, young
lady!
Like Elena cares.   She leans back, nods. Job done.

heading.raw_text: EXT. BLUE BAY HIGH DIVING POOL - DAY

segments.content:
The bright Florida sunshine washes down on packed bleachers by the

          side of the massive diving pool, where a diving meet is in full

          swing...
Blue Bay High School would like to
welcome all participating diving teams
from the tri-county region...
Breathtaking beauties from teams all over the region, in their
school colored bikinis, are scattered around the pool area.
But all eyes are on the home team. Masturbatory fantasies abound
as the Blue Bay Girls' Diving Team runs through stretches...
And as exquisite as these girls are, they pale in comparison to
absolutely sweet Marie, stunning in her nearly see-through white
bathing suit.
First up, district champion Marie

The crowd cheers, watching Marie edge out to the diving platform twenty feet above. Jenny right behind, waits on the ladder... JAY CLIFFORD, Marie's chisel-jawed stepfather in his late thirties, focuses a DIGITAL VIDEO CAMERA on Marie from the front row of the bleachers...

dialogue.text: The crowd cheers, watching Marie edge out to the diving platform twenty feet above. Jenny right behind, waits on the ladder... JAY CLIFFORD, Marie's chisel-jawed stepfather in his late thirties, focuses a DIGITAL VIDEO CAMERA on Marie from the front row of the bleachers...

segments.content: Marie just rolls her eyes.

character.name: C'mon now baby, you can do it...

dialogue.text: Marie just rolls her eyes.

segments.content: Your stepfather's just got a lot invested
in the team.
Marie looks at her stepfather, nods tentatively, but then notices
the incongruous figure of Elena, sidling up to him...
(to Marie)
Just try to keep those legs together.
Shouldn't be a problem for Miss teen
Virgin.
Jay looks round, lowers the camera when he comes face to face with
the world's hottest towel girl...
Excuse me?
You're Mr. Clifford, right? As in
Clifford construction?
I am, yes, but...

Whoa. Jay's lost for words as he diverts his attention to the platform where Marie stands perfectly still before stepping into the air. It's a spectacular sight as the beautiful Marie completes a double back flip, entering the water with near-perfect form. She quickly resurfaces, climbs out of the pool and exchanges high fives with her teammates before crossing to Jay.

character.name: I'd love to see one of your erections...

dialogue.text: Whoa. Jay's lost for words as he diverts his attention to the platform where Marie stands perfectly still before stepping into the air. It's a spectacular sight as the beautiful Marie completes a double back flip, entering the water with near-perfect form. She quickly resurfaces, climbs out of the pool and exchanges high fives with her teammates before crossing to Jay.

segments.content: Nice take off, gotta work on the
landing...
Jay shakes a finger at her, silences her immediately.

dialogue.text: Jay shakes a finger at her, silences her immediately.

segments.content: No such word as 'can't. Now do it again.
Marie takes a deep breath, approaches the ladder once more. As she's about to start the arduous climb, Elena hands her a towel...

dialogue.text: Marie takes a deep breath, approaches the ladder once more. As she's about to start the arduous climb, Elena hands her a towel...

segments.content: Stops Marie in her tracks.

dialogue.text: Stops Marie in her tracks.

segments.content: What's your major malfunction?
Just wanted to make a wager. Between best
friends.
Marie just starts to climb the ladder to the high dive platform.
You blow this dive, I get those diamonds
of yours.
Marie stops, looks down on Elena from the fifth rung of the
ladder, shakes her head...
How'd you know about my inheritance?
Talk of the town, birthday girl. Today's
the day, right?
And what, pray tell, are you willing to
wager when I win?
Elena thinks for a second, glances back at Jay with a big smile.
I'll stay away from your stepfather. You
make it, I won't be your new stepmom
anytime soon. Whattya say?
Marie just stands there incredulous for a moment.
She ascends the ladder, leaving Elena behind...

character.name: Take your sorry ass back to the swamps.

dialogue.text: She ascends the ladder, leaving Elena behind...

segments.content: Marie clambers up onto the high dive platform, tries to focus on the task at hand. But can't help but notice her nemesis below, walking slowly, seductively, up to Jay, intoxicating him... Marie blocks out the distraction, concentrates at the task at hand, stepping to the edge of the platform and the 20 foot drop looming beyond... She slides a ring off her finger, kisses it for luck. It's an odd design. Four curved gold ridges, just ready to hold a Diamond... She throws the ring into the pool ahead of her, the gold glinting in the afternoon sunlight as it drops into the water, and a split second before it breaks the surface, Marie is airborne...

segments.content: She twists magnificently through the air, a sight of breathtaking
beauty. Thank God this is in slow motion.
And as she gets ever closer to the water's surface, she tucks,
does one last back flip, straightening out at the last possible
instant, slicing through the water with nary a splash.
Marie surfaces to roaring APPLAUSE. Treading water, she can't help
but watch her Jay's smiling face in the bleachers...

Sickeningly expensive POWERBOATS and de-rigged SCHOONERS line the

          inlet leading to the verdant lawns of the Clifford Mansion...

          Banners and streamers wishing Marie a happy birthday decorate the

          grounds. Partygoers soak in the blazing Florida sun, sip at non-

          alcoholic punch, and stare out gratefully across the thin stretch

          of water that separates them from the riff-raff on the mainland...

          Marie sits away from it all, lost in thought, as Jenny, in cutoffs

          and a bikini top, sidles up beside her.
What's the matter, sweetie, pissed that
one judge only gave you a 9.7?
Marie forces a smile.
Nah. I'm cool.
Denial ain't just a river in Egypt, babe.
You got diamonds on the mind.
Marie looks round to her stepfather, shakes her head, bringing a bemused look to Jay's face.

character.name: Have either of you seen my video camera?

dialogue.text: Marie looks round to her stepfather, shakes her head, bringing a bemused look to Jay's face.

segments.content: He shrugs, picks up a crystal glass, hits a fork sharply against it, drawing the attention of the assembled partygoers...

character.name: I had it at the dive meet, I'm sure...

dialogue.text: He shrugs, picks up a crystal glass, hits a fork sharply against it, drawing the attention of the assembled partygoers...

segments.content: Ladies, Gentlemen, friends, raise a glass
to Marie, on her eighteenth birthday.
Everyone raises their fine crystal.
She's become every inch of the woman her
Mother hoped she'd be. Wherever she is
now, Julie's looking down and smiling.
Tears well in Marie's eyes...
And that's why, on your eighteenth
birthday, Marie, I know your mother
wanted you to have...
He notices, out of the corner of his eyes, two well-dressed MEN
standing at the entrance to his house. Whoever they are, Jay's
instantly unnerved. He stumbles over his words...
... she wanted you to have... a wonderful
birthday party surrounded by all your
friends.
e glances back toward the house, watching the two men enter...
... and hurries after them.   Marie is left dumbfounded. So close, but so far...

dialogue.text: ... and hurries after them.   Marie is left dumbfounded. So close, but so far...

BARAJAS, stands threateningly over a visibly frightened Jay. Another man, CICATRIZ, dressed in designer silks, stands menacingly in the corner, clearly the brawn of this little operation.

segments.content: Four months is not a delay. It's a
disaster.
You have my word, Mr. Barajas, the
building is almost finished. Just give me
a week, two tops.
Barajas nods to Cicatriz, who moves in on Jay with lightning
quickness, holds a Razor sharp KNIFE against his thumb.
Cicatriz runs the steel blade across Jay's thumb. Marie has to cover her mouth from screaming as she sees a trickle of blood stain the spotless white carpet.

character.name: We are long past the negotiation stage.

segments.content: For every day the building goes
unfinished, we'll take a finger...
A sinister grin stretches across Cicatriz's lips.
Pray, Mr. Clifford, you finish before the
eleventh day...
And with that the Cuban men head to the door. Marie scrambles
away, her heart pounding...
She's halfway down the hallway when Mr. Barajas and Cicatriz exit
Jay's study. She turns, tries to look innocent as the Cuban
'businessmen' stare her down.
ay appears in the doorway, sweat cascading from his brow.
Marie! Shouldn't you be with your
friends?
Cicatriz takes a step towards her.

dialogue.text: Cicatriz takes a step towards her.

segments.content: (to Marie)
I'll be right there. With your gift...
just... wait outside, OK?
Marie backs away, never taking her eyes off the intimidating Cuban
men...

Marie stumbles down the lawns, past the semi-clad partygoers, in a

So? Did you get the key? Are you Blue

Work lights illuminate the half finished condo building site, on

heading.raw_text: INT. TEAM CLIFFORD BUILDING OFFICE - NIGHT

segments.content:
In a concrete makeshift office, on the top floor of the condo

          building, Jay clicks open the lock on his large metal safe and the

          steel door swings open.

          Inside are stacks of CASH, piled high, along with a shiny new

          HANDGUN. Jay flicks through the money, shaking his head...
(sotto)

A clanking noise from outside has him quickly snatching the gun from the safe, before closing it once more, spinning the lock... INT. A perfect rainbow is trapped inside the two flawless Mother

Crocodile tears roll down Elena's cheeks.

Goddamn gloryhounds. They knew I was

well...

nd Chad's left alone with the shattered remains of the video

No answer. INT. CLIFFORD MANSION - KITCHEN - NIGHT Marie enters the lavish kitchen, stops in her tracks when she sees Chad standing at the full bar, mixing the strongest drink known to man.

dialogue.text: No answer. INT. CLIFFORD MANSION - KITCHEN - NIGHT Marie enters the lavish kitchen, stops in her tracks when she sees Chad standing at the full bar, mixing the strongest drink known to man.

segments.content: Chad fidgets nervously.

dialogue.text: Chad fidgets nervously.

segments.content: That parole officer was sniffin' around
today.
Marie scoffs, steps up to the bar, gets in Chad's face.
Not you too. She's just trying to prove
her worthless excuse for an existence.
She doesn't have a thing on us.
Yeah, but she's askin' the right
questions. It's only a matter of time. We
gotta make our move.
Marie shakes her head, resolute.
No. We stick to the plan. Give the
Chad's trembling hands pour the drink, most of the liquid making it in to two MARTINI GLASSES...

character.name: Curator time to come up with the money...

dialogue.text: Chad's trembling hands pour the drink, most of the liquid making it in to two MARTINI GLASSES...

segments.content: We gotta move fast, keep the heat off...
You can't take the heat, get outta the
kitchen.
I wanna see 'em. The diamonds.   Make
sure they're safe.
She downs half the drink in one giant gulp.

dialogue.text: She downs half the drink in one giant gulp.

segments.content: I just wanna see 'em. I thought we were
supposed to be partners here.
Chad's trembling, looking like he could lose it at any second.

She slugs the rest of the drink, strides away and Chad follows like a lapdog... INT. CLIFFORD MANSION - JAY'S OFFICE - NIGHT Nothing's been touched in Jay's office, the drops of blood the Cubans extracted from his thumb as a warning stain the white carpet black... Marie walks over to his desk, opens a draw. Removes a metallic lock box.

character.name: You're gonna be the death of me...

dialogue.text: She slugs the rest of the drink, strides away and Chad follows like a lapdog... INT. CLIFFORD MANSION - JAY'S OFFICE - NIGHT Nothing's been touched in Jay's office, the drops of blood the Cubans extracted from his thumb as a warning stain the white carpet black... Marie walks over to his desk, opens a draw. Removes a metallic lock box.

segments.content: Marie rolls her eyes, takes a key from a delicate chain around her neck and fumbles with the lock. Finally she opens the box, revealing the Mother-Daughter diamonds, resting on velvet lining. The sparkling diamonds seem to have a calming effect on Chad.      He stops shaking, his voice becoming more steady...

character.name: Open it. I wanna see those puppies.

dialogue.text: Marie rolls her eyes, takes a key from a delicate chain around her neck and fumbles with the lock. segments.content: I called the museum. The deal's goin'
down tomorrow. 8 am...
Marie stumbles as she takes a step toward him.
She looks to the empty glass in her hand, then begins to sway, watching in horror as Chad drops the diamonds into his pocket...

dialogue.text: She looks to the empty glass in her hand, then begins to sway, watching in horror as Chad drops the diamonds into his pocket...

segments.content: I'm sorry, okay? But it's not like I had
a choice.
Marie falls flat on her face, her world crashing to BLACK.

The blinding morning sunlight climbs the horizon, the still water

          of the endless swampland glistening like diamonds...

          Elena sits out on her idling airboat, in the midst of the

          sawgrass, smoking. The peace is shattered by her ringing

INT. CLIFFORD MANSION - JAY'S OFFICE - MORNING Marie has the phone cradled between her shoulder and ear, rubbing her aching head, slowly getting her wits back. Nothing like good old fashioned vengeful rage to combat a nasty hangover.

dialogue.text: INT. CLIFFORD MANSION - JAY'S OFFICE - MORNING Marie has the phone cradled between her shoulder and ear, rubbing her aching head, slowly getting her wits back. Nothing like good old fashioned vengeful rage to combat a nasty hangover.

segments.content: (into phone)
Chad fucked us.
(deadpan)
I know. I was there...
No, I mean he really fucked us. He
drugged me an' took the diamonds!
Elena stands on the edge of the airboat, fear rising in her.
ell me you're kidding...
Yeah, it's all a big joke...He stole the
diamonds!
Elena lets out an anguished wail.
Keep it down, my headache's bad enough as
it is.
We've gotta stop him.

Marie's fevered mind is racing as she glances at the wall clock.

          7:30. Finally a desperate plan scratches its way to the surface.
He's heading to the museum, got himself
an 8am meeting...
He's gonna sell the diamonds...

EXT. EVERGLADES - DAY The deafening roar of an air boat cutting through dense sawgrass, speeding across the endless swampland expanse. Elena expertly maneuvers the machine, the wind racing through her hair... EXT. SWAMP ROAD - DAY Chad's speakers blare out heavy metal as his rusty DAEWOO bangs down the desolate swamp dirt road through the thick trees. Every hundred feet or so, the road runs parallel with the water, then cuts back into the trees. C had spots an Air Boat not more than a few hundred yards from him. He does a double take just as the road disappears back into the trees. That wasn't...it couldn't be, could it? The winding dirt road crosses back to swampside and Chad's worst fears come true...Elena's racing along side of him in the AIRBOAT, fighting to keep up...

character.name: Not if we find him first...

segments.content: INT. CHAD'S CAR - DAY The road runs parallel to the swamp again and Chad's eyes nearly burst from their sockets as he sees the airboat now alongside him, matching his speed.

dialogue.text: INT. CHAD'S CAR - DAY The road runs parallel to the swamp again and Chad's eyes nearly burst from their sockets as he sees the airboat now alongside him, matching his speed.

segments.content: Chad's heart stops.

dialogue.text: Chad's heart stops.

segments.content: Us?
He spins round, looks straight ahead at the BMW RACING RIGHT AT

He yanks the steering wheel hard left, swerves his car clean off

          the dirt road and into the thick swathe of Melaluca trees, Marie's

          BMW shoots past, missing his car by inches...

Marie slams on her brakes, brings her BMW to a skidding halt on

          the dirt road. She looks back over her shoulder, at the swaying

          Melaluca trees. No sign of Chad's car...

Elena brings the airboat to rest at swamp side, leaps into the

          reeds and clambers up to the dirt road. There's no sign of Chad's

          car, just a hole in the dense undergrowth where it ploughed

          through...

          Marie comes running up to join Elena, a tire iron in hand...
(sternly)
We're not hurting him, Marie, got it? We
just get the diamonds back...
'm not gonna hurt him. No way...
Marie stalks down the path Chad's car took off the dirt road...
Elena's breath catches in her throat. Marie disappears into the trees and she's alone, out on the deserted swamp road...

dialogue.text: Elena's breath catches in her throat. Marie disappears into the trees and she's alone, out on the deserted swamp road...

segments.content: She hears a scream, a girl's scream...

dialogue.text: She hears a scream, a girl's scream...

segments.content: Elena sprints into the thick of the trees...

dialogue.text: Elena sprints into the thick of the trees...

heading.raw_text: INT. BLUE BAY PD OFFICES - DAY

segments.content:
Kristen is sitting at Detective Morrison's cluttered desk, her

          brow furrowed as she shuffles through the stack of newspaper

          articles she pulled from Elena's wall.

          Morrison stands in the doorway, watching her.
Kristen looks up from the articles, into Morrison's smiling face. She smiles back.

character.name: You look like you could use a drink.

dialogue.text: Kristen looks up from the articles, into Morrison's smiling face. She smiles back.

segments.content: Morrison turns and walks right into a suit with an FBI badge identifying him as AGENT MILTON DAMMERS. The buzzcut agent drops BOXES at Morrison's feet.

character.name: When this is all over, I'd like that.

dialogue.text: Morrison turns and walks right into a suit with an FBI badge identifying him as AGENT MILTON DAMMERS. The buzzcut agent drops BOXES at Morrison's feet.

segments.content: More Black Widow leads. I need you to put
them in the evidence locker, Morrison.
That's not my job, Agent Dammers.

EXT. SWAMP CLEARING - DAY Marie is standing in a clearing, staring at Chad's wrecked car, at the top of a small slope, wrapped around a Melaluca tree like a Christmas present. Her piercing screams force Elena to come running...

dialogue.text: EXT. SWAMP CLEARING - DAY Marie is standing in a clearing, staring at Chad's wrecked car, at the top of a small slope, wrapped around a Melaluca tree like a Christmas present. Her piercing screams force Elena to come running...

segments.content: Marie stops screaming, her face contorting in anger...

dialogue.text: Marie stops screaming, her face contorting in anger...

segments.content: She points to the front seat of the crashed car... Elena can barely bring herself to look inside. Marie shoves her in the back, pushing her towards the open driver's side door. Elena gasps when she looks inside the car. Chad's not there.

character.name: No, I'm pretty damn far from okay...

dialogue.text: She points to the front seat of the crashed car... Elena can barely bring herself to look inside. Marie shoves her in the back, pushing her towards the open driver's side door. Elena gasps when she looks inside the car. Chad's not there.

segments.content: Marie clambers up the wreckage of the car, stands on the roof. She

dialogue.text: Marie clambers up the wreckage of the car, stands on the roof. She

segments.content: surveys the swamp all around her like the lioness she is...

INT. BLUE BAY PD EVIDENCE LOCKER - DAY Morrison grumbles as he scans his key card, opening the wire mesh door to the evidence locker. He picks up a box and enters, Kristen, also carrying a box, a step behind.

dialogue.text: INT. BLUE BAY PD EVIDENCE LOCKER - DAY Morrison grumbles as he scans his key card, opening the wire mesh door to the evidence locker. He picks up a box and enters, Kristen, also carrying a box, a step behind.

segments.content: I appreciate the help...
Morrison blushes as he absently adds the boxes to the groaning shelves stuffed with Black Widow evidence. Kristen notices the bundles of cash stored in and amongst the Black Widow evidence...

dialogue.text: Morrison blushes as he absently adds the boxes to the groaning shelves stuffed with Black Widow evidence. Kristen notices the bundles of cash stored in and amongst the Black Widow evidence...

segments.content: You could have a helluva holiday on that
money.
Recovered from the Black Widow's last
score. If I'd gotten to the scene just
five minutes earlier, I woulda gotten her
as well...
Morrison shakes his head, ruefully, when a sudden sharp beeping
has Kristen reaching into her pocket, fishing out a handheld GPS.
A red flashing dot moves quickly in the middle of the map...

dialogue.text: A red flashing dot moves quickly in the middle of the map...

segments.content: EXT. EVERGLADES - DAY Elena runs full pelt after Marie, through dense swampland, the plastic ankle bracelet around her leg silently flashing red...

dialogue.text: EXT. EVERGLADES - DAY Elena runs full pelt after Marie, through dense swampland, the plastic ankle bracelet around her leg silently flashing red...

segments.content: Chad! There's nowhere to run to, you
little weasel!
She swings around, finally spotting a bloody hand print on one of
the ashen tree trunks...
She races off in hot pursuit. Elena's about to follow when she notices the red light flashing on her ankle bracelet...

dialogue.text: She races off in hot pursuit. Elena's about to follow when she notices the red light flashing on her ankle bracelet...

segments.content: Marie slows, looks back to Elena.

dialogue.text: Marie slows, looks back to Elena.

segments.content: What now?
I'm more than five miles away from the
Police station. I go beyond five miles
and the alarm goes off...
Marie snarls...
You telling me your Parole Officer knows
you're out here?
Elena can barely speak...

EXT. SWAMP - DAY Chad's face is drained of color as he runs through the dense swampland, hugging the priceless diamonds. Sweat cascades from his brow, and thick plumes of blood from wounds all over his body swirl in the stagnant waters... Most gruesome of all is a broken TURN SIGNAL embedded in his right leg. As the water gets knee-deep, the last of Chad's reserve energy goes. He collapses in the stagnant marsh. Not far off, GATORS circle. It's only a matter of time before they notice the blood in the water.

The small bit of solid ground gives way to swampland. Elena steps

          into the water, her Ankle Bracelet FLASHING RED.
Call it off, Marie. We gotta go or
she'll find us here...
A splashing sound from up ahead silences both girls...
The sound echoes off the dense trees. Marie points left.

dialogue.text: The sound echoes off the dense trees. Marie points left.

segments.content: Marie heads off in the opposite direction. Elena hesitates, wants to follow, but does as she's told, and goes left, soon enveloped by canopy of trees... INT. segments.content: (calling out to Elena)
You see him?
No reply, just her own voice echoing back...
She rolls her eyes.

dialogue.text: She rolls her eyes.

segments.content: EXT. SWAMP ROAD - DAY Kristen's unmarked car races across the desolate swamp road. INT. KRISTEN'S CAR - DAY She checks the flashing GPS signal. Getting closer... EXT. EVERGLADES - DAY Elena bursts up to the surface of the bloody water, gasps for breath. Looking down she sees Chad, holding on to her like his life depends on it. It does... He pulls her back down into the water, just as she catches a glance of the circling GATORS... Using her as leverage, Chad pulls himself out of the swamp, climbing over her writhing body to the relative safety of solid ground... Elena coughs and splutters, floundering in the blood soaked water. The ravenous Gators approach, sensing a feeding frenzy...

you in the water, they'll rip you to
pieces...
Elena freezes, looking round at the black eyes breaking the
surface of the bloody water, gliding in for the kill...

She reaches out a hand to Chad, only a few feet away... H e hesitates, then reaches out to her. But stops short of grabbing her trembling hand. Just balls his fist, squeezing every last drop of blood out of the open wounds on his palm... The dark blood cascades down into the water around Elena...

segments.content: And he smiles as the Gators ease open their powerful jaws... WHACK! Chad's eyes roll back into his head as blood flows from his nose, ears and mouth. He falls forward, stiff as a board, and SPLASHES down into the water next to an apoplectic Elena. Behind him stands Marie, the BLOODY TIRE IRON in hand... Marie reaches out a hand, pulls Elena out of the water. She collapses onto her back and sucks in the stagnant swamp air...

about to become dinner...

Kristen approaches a fork in the swamp road at high speed. She

          checks the GPS scanner. It doesn't show her which way to turn...

Split second decision. Left. She spins the wheel, takes the left hand fork... Bad choice. Just a few meters down the right fork is an abandoned BMW, an idle airboat, a crashed car, one dead man and two wild, wild things... EXT. SWAMP ROAD - DAY Elena and Marie, soaked to the bone, drag Chad's cold, dead corpse out of the trees. Marie drops the body, heads straight for her abandoned BMW. Elena follows, stumbling through the vines, her clothes dripping wet, shivering more from nerves than cold...

segments.content: Get rid of the body. And his car...
Where are you going?
Where do you think?
Marie spins round, a vicious look in her eyes. She holds the blood soaked diamonds in her hand...

character.name: I don't...I don't have a clue...

It's only a matter of time before my

character.name: Then I suggest you get to work...

Marie bursts into the Museum, and he strides up to meet her, shocked when he sees Marie's covered in blood, sweat and guilt...

segments.content: Marie? Are you alright?
The Curator nods nervously.

dialogue.text: The Curator nods nervously.

segments.content: I convinced the board of the
extraordinary circumstances
surrounding...
S he fishes in her bag for the diamonds...

dialogue.text: S he fishes in her bag for the diamonds...

segments.content: I...I received a call from your
'associate'. He said he would be handling
the transaction.
Change of plans. My 'associate' got tied
up at work. Completely swamped...
The Curator nods, unsure if he inquire further...
Marie finally pulls out two blood soaked Diamonds from her bag,
thrusts them at the Curator. He screws up his wrinkled face,

EXT. CHAD'S CAR - AFTERNOON With trembling hands, Elena opens the trunk of Chad's crashed car. She pulls out a plastic gas container, sloshing the fuel around inside, then trailing it back across the vine covered ground... She carefully places the empty container down, standing twenty feet back from the wreckage, fumbling in her pocket for a match... She can barely control her hands, her whole body shaking in fear... Finally she pulls out a MATCHBOOK, still sopping wet from the swamp. She strikes match after match, but they won't light, until, finally, one produces a tiny flame that simmers for a second then smoulders out...

segments.content: Don't do this to me, please...
In frustration, she runs back to Chad's car, looking desperately
for a lighter, climbing all the way in. Because of the slight
slope it's on, the car's flimsy door slams shut behind her.
Elena pays no heed, continues to rummage through the glove
compartment.
She's cut off as the WRECKED CAR'S HORN BLARES OUT! Deafening, the sound echoes around the dense undergrowth. Elena's heart skips a beat. Chad's corpse has slumped forward against the steering wheel.

character.name: You gotta have a lighter or some...

segments.content: So?
I...I'm not sure...

character.name: Can you get the cash or not?

dialogue.text: The Curator looks up to her, bemused.

segments.content: I can get the cash...it's just...
Marie smiles a wicked grin.

EXT. CHAD'S CAR - AFTERNOON The discarded match has set fire to the surrounding vines on the ground, and slowly the fire edges it way towards the line of gasoline that Elena trailed from Chad's wrecked car... INSIDE THE CAR Elena reaches over, carefully closes Chad's bloodshot eyes. Satisfied, she turns to get out, only to find the passenger side door LOCKED... She tries the handle. Tries it again. Desperately yanks it. Not opening, no sir... Elena looks over, see Chad's limp elbow on the door lock... OUTSIDE THE CAR The small brush fire reaches the pooled gasoline and...WHOOSH! INSIDE THE CAR Elena can't help but hear the unmistakable sound of FLAMES CRACKLING. Through the smashed rear window she sees the line of FIRE racing towards the car she's trapped in! She reaches over, clawing her way past Chad's corpse, trying to reach the door lock. Her bloody fingers slip on the lock, unable to pull it up. THE FIRE's SHOOTING towards the crashed car, only a few feet away... Elena fumbles with the lock, tears streaming down her face. The line of fire hits the crashed car, and ENGULFS it instantly. Bright ORANGE FLAMES cover the wreckage... INT. MUSEUM - AFTERNOON The Curator carefully sets down the diamonds on the marble floor. Marie looks at him like he's mad.

character.name: Then let's have those dead presidents...

There's a gorgeous beach house with a patio looking out onto this idyllic scene. The swimming pool glistens in the bright tropical Caribbean Sunlight. And stretched out on a recliner in the sheerest of bikinis is none other than Kristen Richards, soaking up rays. At her side is a PAPER SHREDDER, and between sips from a pina colada, she feeds document after document, each one stamped BLACK WIDOW EVIDENCE in red ink... Kristen looks over at Elena, equally stunning in a matching bikini.

dialogue.text: EXT. PARADISE - DAY Soft waves lap against a pristine beach. Palm trees sway in the warm breeze. A steady WHIRRING is the only sound that disturbs the serenity. Is it a lawn mower? A leaf blower? There's a gorgeous beach house with a patio looking out onto this idyllic scene. The swimming pool glistens in the bright tropical Caribbean Sunlight. And stretched out on a recliner in the sheerest of bikinis is none other than Kristen Richards, soaking up rays. At her side is a PAPER SHREDDER, and between sips from a pina colada, she feeds document after document, each one stamped BLACK WIDOW EVIDENCE in red ink... Kristen looks over at Elena, equally stunning in a matching bikini.

segments.content: I can't believe Morrison just handed me
the key to the evidence locker...
A broad grin stretches across her lips as Elena empties the
contents of a velvet pouch onto a table.
he Mother-Daughter diamonds are radiant in the bright sunlight.
Elena nods.

segments.content: Nothin' like the real thing. Switched
'em for the fakes right after Marie tried
to pay me off...

dialogue.text: INT. TEAM CLIFFORD BUILDINGS - DAY Morrison paces the infamous crime scene, at wit's end. Dammers stands off to the side, just watching him with a bemused look etched across his face.

segments.content: She was the Black Widow. Her and that
little...
He tries to think of an appropriate slur for Elena. Can't come up
with anything, continues pacing frantically.
Dammers shrugs.

dialogue.text: Dammers shrugs.

segments.content: Hind sight's 20-20. No need to be so hard
on yourself, Morrison...
(beat, smile)
That's my job.
You smug son of a bitch. It's not like
you knew who she was anymore than I did.
Dammers nods slowly.
That's the God's honest truth. But at
least I didn't give her my evidence
locker keycard.
And I didn't lie about who fired the

heading.subject: shots that killed the Clifford kid.
heading.raw_text: shots that killed the Clifford kid.

heading.raw_text: Morrison's heart sinks. He looks like he's going to faint.

segments.content:
Steadies himself, placing both hands against the wall, just as Jay

          did that fateful night seemingly a lifetime ago...

Dammers leads Morrison to his awaiting car. They pass MR. Barajas

          and Cicatriz. Mr. Barajas is in his usual foul mood...
Morrison stops, regards Barajas...

character.name: Un pinche sink hole! No lo puedo creer!

dialogue.text: Morrison stops, regards Barajas...

segments.content: What did you say?
The foundation is sinking. The entire
site is a sink hole. It's completely
worthless.
I'm going to kill Jay Clifford...

dialogue.text: EXT. PARADISE - DAY Elena and Kristen lay side-by-side on loungers, soaking in the sun, when a voice rouses them...

segments.content: Poor Detective Morrison. It's hard to do
that to a friend. Especially one going
through such a nasty divorce.
They look up to see Jay, standing before them in a pair of
colorful shorts, no shirt, sipping at a martini...
Told me he'd never trust another woman as
long as he lived. And then along came a
spider...
Jay glances at Elena, as he downs the last drops from his drink.

dialogue.text: Jay glances at Elena, as he downs the last drops from his drink.

segments.content: More like widows... Gotta say I was a
little taken aback when you wanted to
snuff Marie, but you know what, I'm over
the bitch...
Elena suddenly gets to her feet.
You want me to top you off?
He hands Elena his empty glass, then kisses Kristen tenderly. When they break...

dialogue.text: He hands Elena his empty glass, then kisses Kristen tenderly. When they break...

segments.content: Kristen doesn't reply. Just smiles, watches Elena over by the outside bar, mixing Jay's drink...

character.name: She's got a good head on her shoulders.

dialogue.text: Kristen doesn't reply. Just smiles, watches Elena over by the outside bar, mixing Jay's drink...

segments.content: You two got me out of a mountain of shit,
I'll tell you that. Craziest Goddamn
scheme I've ever heard of. But hell, you
played it perfectly.
My job was easy. It was Elena who had to
keep it all together...
Jay turns around, smiles at Elena as she holds out his drink.

character.name: We've had some practice along the way...

dialogue.text: Jay turns around, smiles at Elena as she holds out his drink.

segments.content: Jay takes it from her appreciatively, sips at it as he sidles off to the swimming pool.

dialogue.text: Jay takes it from her appreciatively, sips at it as he sidles off to the swimming pool.

segments.content: Well, all that nasty business, it's
behind us. Forever. From here on out,
it's the good life.
He starts to climb the high dive. When he gets to the top, he
looks down at Elena and Kristen, smiles.
You two look so good, it's difficult to
tell which one's the mother and which
one's the daughter...
Kristen calls back up at him.
Says it so sweetly, it takes a moment for Jay to register the sinister implications...

dialogue.text: Says it so sweetly, it takes a moment for Jay to register the sinister implications...

segments.content: His eyes are blood shot. He starts to sway atop the high dive.

dialogue.text: His eyes are blood shot. He starts to sway atop the high dive.

segments.content: Delta Chi, class of '88. Hellova party.
I'd never really tasted cocktails like
that.
Jay's swaying uneasily on the high dive platform...
I don't...whattya talking about?
It was like being awake though an
operation. I could feel everything
happening, but I couldn't do anything to
stop it...
Oh...shit...
You took something from me that night.
Jay's head is spinning as he looks to Kristen, to Elena.

dialogue.text: Jay's head is spinning as he looks to Kristen, to Elena.

segments.content: He can't quite get his mind around it. Everything's becoming blurry.

dialogue.text: He can't quite get his mind around it. Everything's becoming blurry.

segments.content: I don't remember...
He looks at the martini glass, thinks he sees blue residue, before
it slips from his fingers, falls 20 feet to the concrete below,
shattering into a million pieces like so many fake diamonds...
lena and Kristen stand side-by-side below him.
A broad grin stretches across Elena's lips as she finishes...

dialogue.text: A broad grin stretches across Elena's lips as she finishes...

segments.content: ...But you'll never forget.
Jay tries to take a step forward. He stumbles. Tries in vain to
regain his balance. It's too late. He falls. 20 feet to the
unyielding concrete, exploding like a paper bag filled with
vegetable soup...
They stand back, watching Jay's pancaked body draining its precious blood into the ice blue pool...

character.name: Nice take off. Gotta work on the landing.

dialogue.text: They stand back, watching Jay's pancaked body draining its precious blood into the ice blue pool...
